entries.name: Bovidian Traits
entries: The Bovidians are a proud and resilient race, inspired by the strength and communal spirit of bison. They are deeply connected to the land and hold traditions of endurance and unity.

entries.name: Natural Armour
entries: You have thick, leathery hide. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier.
You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC.
A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}), Wisdom ({@skill Survival}), and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks that involve smell.

entries.name: Keen Hearing
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sound.

entries.name: Horns
entries: You have horns that you can use to make unarmed strikes.
When you hit with them, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier piercing damage instead of the normal bludgeoning damage of an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Goring Rush
entries: Immediately after you take the {@variantrule Dash} action on your turn and move at least 20 feet, you can make one melee attack with your horns as a bonus action.

entries.name: Hammering Horns
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee attack as part of the {@variantrule Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to push that target with your horns.
The target must be within 5 feet of you and no more than one size larger than you.
Unless it succeeds on a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier), you push it up to 10 feet away from you.

race.name: Drakari
race.age: Drakari commonly live 500 years, with rare individuals reaching 700.
race.alignment: A Drakari's alignment often reflects the nature of the dragon lineage they descend from.

entries.name: Quadrupedal Movement
entries: You can move on all fours or on two legs. Your {@variantrule speed} changes depending on your posture.

entries.name: Wings
entries: You have a flying speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Long-Limbed
entries: When you make a {@variantrule melee} attack on your turn, your reach for that attack is 5 feet greater than normal.

entries.name: Draconic Darkvision
entries: Your senses evolve as you grow in power.

entries.name: Unarmed Strikes
entries: You can make a bite attack that deals {@damage 1d6} piercing damage once per turn instead of a normal unarmed strike.
Your claw unarmed strikes deal {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

entries.name: Charged Attacks
entries: You can empower one of your unarmed strikes with elemental energy tied to your draconic lineage. You can use this feature once per short or long rest.
You also gain {@variantrule resistance} to the damage type associated with your lineage, except for Gray Drakari.

entries.name: Draconic Lineage
entries: Choose one lineage to determine the damage type of your Charged Attack and your {@variantrule resistance} (if any).

entries.name: Gray Drakari Special
entries: Gray Drakari do not gain a damage resistance. Instead, their unarmed strikes deal magical slashing or piercing damage and scale with level:
• Level 1: {@damage 1d8}
• Level 6: {@damage 1d10}
• Level 11: {@damage 1d12}
• Level 16: {@damage 1d20}

entries.name: Living Construct
entries: You do not need to eat, drink, or breathe.
Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 8 hours. You dream during this state.

entries.name: Integrated Armor
entries: Your body includes built-in armor plating.
Your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier (maximum +2).
If you are proficient in light armor, add your proficiency bonus to this AC.

entries.name: Arcane Heart
entries: As a bonus action, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier.
You regain use of this feature after finishing a {@variantrule long rest}.

entries.name: Arcane Heritage
entries: You have {@variantrule resistance} to necrotic damage.
You add your Intelligence modifier (if positive) to saving throws against spells and magical effects.

entries.name: Forgeborn Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.
You have {@variantrule resistance} to poison damage.

entries.name: Constructed Mind
entries: You gain proficiency in one Intelligence-based skill of your choice.

entries.name: Body Modification System
entries: At the end of a long rest, you may modify one component of your body: arms, legs, torso, or head.
Each modification grants a benefit and a drawback. Modifications last until your next long rest.

items: Wheels: Increased speed, disadvantage on Strength saves vs being knocked prone.
Spring-Loaded Legs: Greatly increased jumping distance, disadvantage on Dexterity saves to maintain balance.
Extra Arms: Can interact with multiple objects at once, cannot use shields, difficulty in tight spaces.
Telescopic Neck: Extended vision/reach, vulnerable to grapple attempts.
Enhanced Headlamp: Improved darkvision, disadvantage on {@skill Stealth} checks.

entries: All modifications require DM approval.

entries.name: Built for Battle
entries: You gain proficiency with one martial weapon of your choice.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Stealthy Design
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill.

entries.name: Lockpick Mechanism
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item thieves' tools} and have advantage on checks to pick locks.

entries.name: Shadowmeld
entries: You can cast the {@spell Darkness} spell once per long rest without material components.
Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Mobile Combatant
entries: When you Dash, {@variantrule difficult terrain} does not cost extra movement.
Opportunity attacks against you are made with {@variantrule disadvantage}.

entries.name: Precision Strike
entries: As a reaction, add your proficiency bonus to an attack roll.
You regain use of this feature after a short or long rest.

entries.name: Artisan's Expertise
entries: You gain proficiency with one {@item artisan's tool} of your choice.

entries.name: Master Craftsman
entries: You craft items in half the usual time and at half the usual cost.
Items you craft may gain a minor magical property (DM discretion).

entries.name: Artificer's Legacy
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks to identify magical items.

entries.name: Arcane Prowess
entries: You can cast {@spell Mage Armor} at will without material components.

entries.name: Spellbook Adept
entries: You gain proficiency in Arcana.
You add half your proficiency bonus to Intelligence checks you are not proficient in.

monster.name: Elemental of Fate
languages: understands its bonded creature but cannot speak

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: The Elemental of Fate can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• {@spell Augury} (at will)
• {@spell Guidance} (at will)
Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom.

trait.name: Elemental Bond
entries: The Elemental of Fate is bound to a specific creature and cannot be controlled by anyone else.
It can communicate telepathically with its bonded creature over any distance on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Invisible to Others
entries: Only the bonded creature can see the Elemental of Fate.
It cannot be targeted by enemies. The only way it can take damage is from area-of-effect abilities.

trait.name: Respawn
entries: The Elemental of Fate does not heal naturally. If reduced to 0 hit points, it dissipates and reforms beside its bonded creature at the end of the next long rest with full hit points.

trait.name: Daily Fate Effects
entries: At the end of each long rest, choose two of the following effects to be active for the day:
• Foresight: The bonded creature has advantage on {@initiative} rolls.

• True Sight: The bonded creature gains 15 feet of {@variantrule truesight} and can see {@variantrule invisible} creatures, see through magical darkness, automatically detect visual illusions, and perceive true forms of shapechangers.
• Shared Fortune: The bonded creature has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
• Guiding Touch: Once per day, the bonded creature can reroll an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and must use the new roll.
• Resonance of Destiny: The bonded creature's attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} force damage.
• Blessing of Evasion: The bonded creature gains the {@variantrule Evasion} feature.
• Fate's Insight: The bonded creature has advantage on Intelligence checks related to {@skill history}, {@skill religion}, and {@skill arcana}.

action.name: Fate's Ward (Recharge 6)
entries: The Elemental of Fate creates a protective barrier around its bonded creature.
The bonded creature gains a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws for 1 round.

The Elemental of Fate appears as a shimmering figure composed of radiant energy, surrounded by swirling threads of destiny. Its form constantly shifts and flickers, as though not fully anchored to the physical world.
Only its bonded creature can perceive it, and its presence subtly shapes the flow of fate around them.

monster.name: Inanimate Mimic
languages: understands the languages of its bonded creature but cannot speak

trait.name: Telepathic Whisper
entries: The mimic can communicate telepathically with one creature at a time within 60 feet. The voice always seems to originate from the object it is imitating. It cannot communicate with more than one creature at once.

trait.name: Unseen Motion
entries: While a creature is observing the mimic, its speed is no more than 5 feet. When no creature is actively perceiving it, its speed increases to 40 feet and it can climb walls and ceilings. It leaves no tracks or sound while moving unobserved.

trait.name: Perfect Stillness
entries: While motionless, the mimic is indistinguishable from a mundane object of its chosen form. A creature must succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern its true nature.

trait.name: Object Mimicry
entries: The mimic can imitate any {@variantrule Tiny} object no larger than 1 cubic foot. It perfectly replicates weight, texture, temperature, and appearance. It can also mimic any voice or sound it has heard.

trait.name: Companion Bond
entries: If treated kindly, the mimic bonds to a creature. It always returns to its bonded creature, can store up to 5 pounds of items inside its body, and can mimic the bonded creature's voice perfectly.

trait.name: Adhesive
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A creature that touches the mimic must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or become stuck to it. The mimic can release a creature at will.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the mimic can't bite another target.

An Inanimate Mimic Companion is a small, curious aberration that prefers to imitate handheld objects rather than furniture or doors. It forms emotional bonds, communicates through telepathic whispers, and moves with unsettling speed when unobserved. Many adventurers treat them as strange but loyal pets.

monster.name: Time Elemental
languages: understands the languages of its summoner but can't speak

trait.name: Elemental Form
entries: The time elemental does not require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: The elemental's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15). It can cast the following spells:

items: At will: {@spell haste}, {@spell slow}
1/day: {@spell time stop}

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the elemental fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The elemental has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Reactive Time
entries: The elemental can take one reaction on every creature's turn.

trait.name: Time Warp (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the elemental enters a temporal flux for 1 minute.

items: Advantage on all attack rolls and ability checks
One extra action per turn
Creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution save or be affected by slow for 1 minute

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Temporal Distortion (Recharge 5–6)
entries: The elemental creates a 60-foot {@variantrule cube} of warped time. Creatures must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom save or be affected by slow for 1d4–2 rounds.

monster.name: Dargûl
languages: understands languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If destroyed, the Dargûl reforms in 1d6 days unless cured.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: In {@variantrule dim light} or {@variantrule darkness}, the Dargûl can {@variantrule Hide} as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shadow Aura
entries: Creatures within 5 feet must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom save or be {@condition frightened} until the end of their turn.

trait.name: Shadow Resistance
entries: The Dargûl has advantage on saving throws against effects that alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Dargûl makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing plus 8 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shadow Drain
entries: A creature within 5 feet must make a DC 13 Constitution save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and the Dargûl gains that many temporary hit points.

action.name: Shadow Strike (1/Day)
entries: The Dargûl becomes incorporeal for 1 minute and deals an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage when moving through creatures.

monster.name: Ice Wraith
languages: understands languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Ice Aura
entries: Creatures within 10 feet take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage at the start of their turn.

trait.name: Frostbite
entries: Melee attacks deal an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through creatures and objects, taking 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith uses Frightful Presence and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Frostbite Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries: 15-foot {@variantrule cone}, DC 14 Dexterity save, 35 ({@damage 10d6}) cold damage or half.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom save or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

monster.name: Ice Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The golem regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ice Storm (Recharge 5–6)
entries: 20-foot radius {@variantrule sphere} centered on the golem. DC 15 Dexterity save, 45 ({@damage 10d8}) cold damage or half.

reaction.name: Icy Barrier
entries: When targeted by a spell, the golem gains temporary hit points equal to its current hit points until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Cold Aura
entries: Creatures within 10 feet must make a DC 15 Constitution save or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

trait.name: Ice Bite
entries: On hit, target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength save or be {@condition grappled}. Grappled creatures take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.

trait.name: Ice Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries: 15-foot {@variantrule cone}, DC 15 Dexterity save, 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage or half.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ice worm makes one Ice Bite attack and one Icy Blast attack.

action.name: Icy Blast (1/Day)
entries: 20-foot radius {@variantrule burst} centered on the worm. DC 15 Dexterity save, 27 ({@damage 6d8}) cold damage or half.

deity.name: Tempus
deity.title: Old God of War (Slain by {@deity Grob Raventail})
deity.symbol: A shattered crimson helm

deity.name: Asmodaen
deity.title: The Betrayer
deity.symbol: A broken mask split down the center

deity.name: Hecatontagon
deity.title: God of Destiny
deity.symbol: A many‑angled eye surrounded by threads

deity.name: Titan
deity.title: God of Chaos
deity.symbol: A swirling vortex of fractured stone

deity.name: Aelindra
deity.title: Goddess of Dreams
deity.symbol: A crescent moon cradling a sleeping eye

deity.name: Arvanador
deity.title: God of the Forge
deity.symbol: A hammer striking an anvil of flame

deity.name: Xaylene Xeranos
deity.title: God of Merchants
deity.symbol: A coin stamped with a shifting sigil

deity.name: Anastasia Anamara
deity.title: Goddess of Blood
deity.symbol: A chalice overflowing with crimson

deity.name: Grob Raventail
deity.title: God of War
deity.symbol: A raven perched atop a war‑torn banner

deity.name: Leylani
deity.title: Fledgling Goddess of the Moon (Slain by the Cult of {@deity Cthulhu})
deity.symbol: A dim silver crescent

deity.name: Lothwyn
deity.title: Failed Fledgling Goddess of the Moon (Slain by Asmodaen)
deity.symbol: A cracked lunar disc

deity.name: Cthulhu
deity.title: The Great Demon
deity.symbol: A mass of writhing tendrils

deity.name: Maraxus
deity.title: Oracle Demon
deity.symbol: A horned skull with a third eye

deity.name: Lolth
deity.title: Spider Demon
deity.symbol: A spider with a bleeding sigil

deity.name: Termina
deity.title: Enforcer of Ascension Challenges
deity.symbol: A blade suspended over a spiral

deity.name: Dendar
deity.title: The Night Serpent, Eater of the World
deity.symbol: A serpent devouring a star

deity.name: Korg
deity.title: King of the Gods, God of Lightning, Thunder, and Justice
deity.symbol: A hammer wreathed in lightning

deity.name: Nalani
deity.title: Queen of the Gods, Goddess of Marriage, Childbirth, and Fertility
deity.symbol: A blooming flower encircled by a silver ring

deity.name: Pethaida
deity.title: God of the Sea, Earthquakes, and Horses
deity.symbol: A trident rising from crashing waves

deity.name: Thainith
deity.title: Goddess of Wisdom, War, and Crafts
deity.symbol: An owl perched on a crossed spear and spindle

deity.name: Solaria
deity.title: God of the Sun, Music, and Prophecy
deity.symbol: A radiant sunburst with a lyre at its center

deity.name: Orion
deity.title: Goddess of the Hunt, Wilderness, and Childbirth
deity.symbol: A bow over a crescent moon

deity.name: Zarin
deity.title: God of War
deity.symbol: A blood‑red shield marked with a single slash

deity.name: Eros
deity.title: God of Wine, Celebration, and Fertility
deity.symbol: A goblet overflowing with grapes

deity.name: Verin
deity.title: God of the Underworld
deity.symbol: A black crown above a skull

deity.name: Selûne
deity.title: Goddess of the Moon, Darkness, Illusion, and Mystery
deity.symbol: A dark crescent moon veiled in mist

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Crystal Cutlass
entries: {@i A Blade Forged from Rage and Will}

Barbarians who follow the Path of the Crystal Cutlass manifest a weapon born from their own fury. Their rage crystallizes into a shimmering blade that grows in power as their mastery deepens. These warriors carve through the battlefield with prismatic force, their strikes echoing with raw emotional resonance.

subclassFeature.name: Crystal Cutlass
entries: When you choose this path at 3rd level, you manifest a crystalline blade formed from your rage and willpower.
As a bonus action, you summon a Crystal Cutlass into your hand. It counts as a martial melee weapon you are proficient with, dealing {@damage 1d10} slashing damage.
The cutlass is magical and disappears if it leaves your hand or if you dismiss it (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Crystal Resonance
entries: While raging, your Crystal Cutlass resonates with primal energy.

items: You deal an additional {@damage 1d6} force damage on hit.
You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.
Your cutlass sheds {@variantrule bright light} in a 10-foot radius and {@variantrule dim light} for an additional 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Shattered Edge
entries: Your cutlass can fracture into shards of force.
When you hit a creature with your Crystal Cutlass, you may force it to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier).
On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} force damage and has disadvantage on its next attack roll.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Strength modifier (minimum 1), regaining all uses on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fractured Fury
entries: Your rage causes your cutlass to split into mirrored afterimages.

items: Creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attacks against you.
When you take the Attack action, you may make one additional attack with your Crystal Cutlass. This attack deals force damage instead of slashing.

subclassFeature.name: Prismatic Execution
entries: Your cutlass can unleash a devastating prismatic strike.
As an action while raging, you make a single melee attack with your Crystal Cutlass. On hit, the target takes an additional {@damage 6d8} damage. Roll a d6 to determine the damage type:
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

vehicle.name: The Visionary

control.name: Arcane Helm
entries: The helm channels the ship's arcane core. The Visionary moves up to the speed of one of its movement components, with one 90-degree turn.
If the helm is destroyed, the Visionary cannot turn or use Captained Actions.
120 ft. (wooden hull)
90 ft. (adamantine hull)
60 ft. (behir scale hull)
60 ft. (all hull types)

weapon.name: Arcane Siege Cannons
entries: The Visionary mounts 6 cannons per side. Each cannon requires 2 operators.
These cannons are arcane siege weapons and deal double damage to structures and ships.

action.name: Arcane Cannon Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 600 ft., one target. {@h}8d8 + 8 magical bludgeoning damage. Siege Weapon: deals double damage to objects and structures.

action: On its turn, The Visionary can take one of the Captained Actions below. It cannot take these actions if it has no captain at the helm.

items.name: Arcane Movement (1 Captained Action)
items.entry: The Visionary magically moves up to 120 feet in any direction.

items.name: Cannon Overcharge (1 Captained Action)
items.entry: The next two cannon attacks made before the end of the round have advantage.

items.name: Material Shift (2 Captained Actions)
items.entry: The Visionary magically changes its hull and mast between Wooden (AC 19), Adamantine (AC 21), and Behir Scales (AC 24).

items.name: Arcane Teleport (3 Captained Actions)
items.entry: The Visionary teleports up to 120 feet, taking all creatures aboard with it.

items.name: Self-Repair (3 Captained Actions)
items.entry: For the next 4 turns, the Visionary regains 2d8 + 4 hit points at the start of each of its turns. This effect can stack if used multiple rounds in a row.

entries: The Visionary is a sentient arcane vessel bonded to its rightful captain, {@deity Grob Raventail}. Its hull and mast can shift between multiple magical materials, and its arcane core grants it extraordinary maneuverability and resilience.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: The Visionary has a Charisma of 17 (+3), Intelligence of 19 (+4), and Wisdom of 21 (+5).
It speaks telepathically only to its rightful captain, {@deity Grob Raventail}.

entries.name: Captained Resistances (2/day)
entries: As a reaction, the captain may grant the Visionary resistance to all damage until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Spirit Meddling
entries: You invoke subtle spiritual interference, producing one of the following effects within range:

items: Send a chill down a creature's spine, heightening their alertness.
Levitate a small object (up to 1.5 lbs) 1–2 feet off the ground.
Gradually lower the temperature of a room.
Generate quiet, unintelligible whispers.
Manifest a faint ghostly apparition that vanishes after a few seconds.
Thicken the air around a creature, making it harder to breathe.
Extinguish candles or torches within a 5-foot radius with a gust of wind.
Cause small objects to shift slightly, as if nudged by an unseen hand.
Echo distant, eerie laughter through the area.
Induce a brief sensation of vertigo, making the ground feel unstable.
Emit a lingering musty odor.
Form a thin layer of frost on nearby surfaces.

spell.name: Remove Breath
entries: You wrench the breath from a creature's lungs. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it begins to suffocate and takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage.
The effect ends at the start of the creature's next turn unless interrupted (such as by casting this spell again or choking the target).
This spell has no effect on creatures that do not breathe air, such as most undead, constructs, or aquatic beings.

spell.name: Agony Warp
entries: You lash two creatures of your choice other than you with writhing shadow. Each must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure of {@i either} creature, choose one effect for each target (you cannot choose the same effect for both):
If one creature succeeds its saving throw while the other fails, the successful target suffers a reduced effect instead of the full effect.

items: The target suffers disadvantage on all attack rolls.
The target takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries: Each affected creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If one target succeeds but the other fails, the successful target suffers a reduced effect:

items: Attack penalty is halved (min. -2) and the target no longer has disadvantage.
The necrotic damage the target takes from this spell is halved.

entries.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@damage 1d6} per slot level above 1st.
Additionally, the attack penalty increases by –2 for each spell slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Greater Agony Warp
entries: You tear open a rift of writhing shadow that binds the fates of two creatures of your choice other than you. Each must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure of {@i either} creature, choose one effect for each target (you may choose the same effect or different ones):
If one creature succeeds its saving throw while the other fails, the successful target suffers a reduced effect instead of the full effect.

items: The target suffers disadvantage and a –2 penalty on all attack rolls and becomes {@condition Tormented}.
The target takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns and becomes {@condition Tormented}.

entries: A Tormented creature is fate‑linked to the other target. Whenever one Tormented creature takes damage from this spell, the other takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. This psychic damage does not trigger additional psychic damage.
Each affected creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. The spell does not fully end on either target until both succeed on their saving throws.
If only one target succeeds its saving throw while the other continues to fail, the successful target suffers a reduced effect instead of ending the spell's influence:

items: Attack penalty is halved (min. -3) and the target no longer has disadvantage.
The necrotic damage the target takes from this spell is halved.
The target is no longer Tormented and no longer takes psychic damage from this spell.

entries.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@damage 1d6} per slot level above 4th.
Additionally, the attack penalty increases by –2 for each spell slot level above 4th.
Additionally, the psychic damage shared between Tormented creatures increases by {@damage 1d6} for every two slot levels above 4th.

spell.name: Agony Cataclysm
entries: You unleash a catastrophic rift of shadow that binds the souls of two creatures of your choice other than you. Each must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure of {@i either} creature, choose one effect for each target (you may choose the same effect or different ones):
Regardless of the number of targets that fail their saving throws, both targets suffer the full effects.

items: The target suffers disadvantage and a –4 penalty on all attack rolls and becomes {@condition Tormented}.
The target takes {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns and becomes {@condition Tormented}.

entries: A Tormented creature is fate‑linked to the other target. Whenever one Tormented creature takes damage from this spell, the other takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage. This psychic damage does not trigger additional psychic damage.
Each affected creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. The spell does not fully end on either target until both succeed on their saving throws.
If only one target succeeds its saving throw while the other continues to fail, the successful target suffers a reduced effect instead of ending the spell's influence:

items: Attack penalty is halved (min. -4) and the target no longer has disadvantage.
The necrotic damage the target takes from this spell is halved.
The target is no longer Tormented, but still takes psychic damage from this spell, though it is halved.

entries.name: Cataclysmic Backlash
entries: If either target is reduced to 0 hit points while both are still affected by this spell, the other target (if it has the tormented condition) immediately takes {@damage 8d6} psychic damage and must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition Stunned} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@damage 1d6} per slot level above 6th.
Additionally, the psychic damage shared between Tormented creatures increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 6th.
Additionally, the attack penalty increases by –2 for each spell slot level above 4th.
The Cataclysmic Backlash damage increases by {@damage 2d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Nauseate
entries: You attempt to overwhelm a creature's senses with nausea and disorientation. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for the duration. While poisoned in this way:

items: The target has disadvantage on saving throws.
Attack rolls against the target have advantage.

entries: The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage (without disadvantage). On a success, the effect ends.
Creatures that do not eat or lack a functioning stomach are immune.

entries.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target one additional creature per slot level above 1st. Targets must be within 30 feet of each other.

spell.name: Curse
entries: You inflict a minor curse on a creature or object. Make a melee spell attack against a target within reach. On a hit, choose one of the following effects:

items: The target takes {@damage 2d4} necrotic damage the next time it is hit by an attack.
The target cannot take bonus actions.
The target cannot take reactions.
The target's movement speed is reduced by 10 feet.
The target's vision is dimmed, as if in {@variantrule low light}.

entries: You may also curse an object, causing anyone who carries it to suffer the chosen effect. Alternatively, you may curse a 5-foot radius on the ground. Any creature entering or starting its turn in that space must make a Charisma saving throw, suffering the curse on a failed save.

entries.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@damage 2d4} per slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Wanddle
entries: You enchant a creature within range to lose control of its movement. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, at the start of each of its turns, it involuntarily moves 1/4 of its movement speed in a random direction, without expending any movement or provoking opportunity attacks.
At the end of each of its turns, the target may repeat the saving throw to end the effect.

entries.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the involuntary movement increases by 1/4 of the target's speed per slot level above 1st.

item.name: Grafted Sleeve of the Ironbound
entries: This rune‑stitched sleeve fuses to the wearer upon attunement, replacing their arm with a fully integrated arcane prosthetic. The transformation is permanent and cannot be reversed by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell or the Fates card from {@item the Deck of Many Things}.

entries.name: Irreversible Graft
entries: When you attune to this item, your arm from the shoulder down is destroyed and replaced by a mechanical prosthetic. This effect cannot be undone except by {@spell wish} or the Fates card.
If attunement ends, the prosthetic remains but loses its magical functions.

entries.name: Mechanical Precision
entries: You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks involving lifting, pushing, or grappling.
Your unarmed strikes with the prosthetic deal {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage or {@damage 1d6} slashing damage (your choice on each hit).

entries.name: Integrated Tools
entries: The prosthetic contains retractable {@item thieves' tools}, {@item tinker's tools}, and one {@item artisan's tool} of your choice.
You are considered proficient with these tools while using the prosthetic.

entries.name: Arcane Grip
entries: You cannot be disarmed of anything held in the prosthetic hand unless you choose to release it.

entries.name: Overdrive Surge (Recharge 5–6)
entries: As a bonus action, you flood the prosthetic with raw arcane energy for 1 minute.

items: Your melee attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} force damage.
Your {@variantrule carrying capacity} is doubled.
You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

entries: When the surge ends, you gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.

entries.name: Failsafe Discharge
entries: If you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, the prosthetic releases a defensive burst.
Creatures of your choice within 10 feet must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} lightning damage.
This ability recharges after a long rest.

entries.name: Cursed Integration
entries: The prosthetic cannot be removed, replaced, or regrown by any spell or effect short of {@spell wish} or the Fates card.
The item is not malevolent, but its magic is absolute.

item.name: The Fury of the Bloodstorm
entries: The Fury of the Bloodstorm is a massive glaive made of a rare and incredibly strong metal that glows with a faint red aura. The weapon is covered in runes that pulse with power, and it feels warm to the touch.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.
This weapon can hold a maximum of 50 charges.

entries.name: Bloodstorm
entries: When you enter a rage, the weapon begins to pulse with red energy.
You deal an additional {@damage 2d6} damage on all melee attacks made with the weapon.
Any creature within 30 feet of you that is not immune to being {@condition frightened} must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.
You gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt by the weapon.

entries.name: Blood Fury
entries: You may expend 3 charges to activate Blood Fury.
You enter a frenzied state, gaining an additional attack on each of your turns and doubling your movement speed.
You gain {@variantrule resistance} to all damage except psychic damage.
You take {@damage 4d6} true damage at the start of each of your turns.
This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you are reduced to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Blood Curse
entries: You may expend 5 charges to activate Blood Curse.
When you hit a creature with the weapon, you may curse it.
The creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be cursed for 24 hours.
A cursed creature takes an additional {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage from all attacks made against it and has disadvantage on all saving throws.
The curse ends early if the creature receives a {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

entries.name: Blood Sacrifice
entries: You may expend 8 charges to activate Blood Sacrifice.
You may sacrifice any number of hit points (up to your maximum) to gain an equal number of charges.
If you sacrifice all of your hit points this way, you gain an additional {@damage 3d6} damage on all melee attacks for 1 minute and cannot be reduced below 1 hit point during that time.

entries.name: Blood Nova
entries: You may expend 15 charges to unleash a Blood Nova.
Each creature of your choice within 30 feet must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.
You gain temporary hit points equal to the total damage dealt.

item.name: Band of Time
entries: This silver band is etched with shifting runes that seem to move backward and forward in time.

entries.name: Temporal Shift
entries: As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you may shift yourself one second backward in time, causing the attack to miss.
You may use this feature twice per long rest.

entries.name: Accelerate
entries: As a bonus action, you may accelerate your personal timeline.
For 1 minute, you gain an additional action on each of your turns.
Once used, this feature cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Luna's Fang
item.reqAttune: by a barbarian with a focus on nature and the moon
entries: Luna's Fang is a massive great axe carved from a single piece of moonstone, shimmering with ethereal light. The haft is ash wood, and the head is adorned with carvings of animals and plants.

entries.name: Moonlit Strike
entries: Once per day as a bonus action, you may empower the axe.
Your next attack deals an additional {@damage 2d8} radiant damage.
The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Nature's Fury
entries: While in a natural environment, you gain +4 to Strength and Constitution scores.
Your movement speed increases by 20 feet.
You have advantage on all ability checks and saving throws against spells and magical effects.
When you take the Attack action, you may make one additional attack as a bonus action.

entries.name: Crescent Sweep
entries: Once per day, you may make a sweeping attack against all enemies within 20 feet.
Each creature must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 6d8} slashing damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
Creatures that succeed take half damage and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Moonlit Path
entries: You always know the phase of the moon.
You can navigate perfectly in any natural environment, even in total darkness or storms.

entries.name: Lunar Fury
entries: Once per day, you may grant yourself and allies within 30 feet temporary hit points equal to your barbarian level + your Constitution modifier.
For 1 minute, your attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d6} radiant damage.
Creatures damaged by Luna's Fang must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Moonburst
entries: As an action, you create a 30-foot radius of radiant moonlight for 1 minute.
The light dispels {@variantrule darkness} and {@variantrule dim light}.
Hostile creatures in the area have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
You have advantage on attack rolls against them.

A hostile creature entering or starting its turn in the area takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage and must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its turn.
This ability recharges at dawn.

item.name: Boons of the Oracle's Seal
entries: This fractured seal contains the power of {@deity Maraxus}, the Oracle Demon. As more fragments are recovered, the seal awakens and grants progressively greater boons. The seal's magic is tied directly to {@deity Maraxus}, and its power grows as he nears release.

entries.name: 1 Fragment — Whisper of the Oracle
entries: As an action, you may ask {@deity Maraxus} a question about the future. He answers truthfully to the best of his limited ability.

entries.name: 2 Fragments — Edge of Prophecy
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to all attack rolls you make.

entries.name: 3 Fragments — Commune with the Oracle
entries: You can cast {@spell commune} once per day, but only to speak with {@deity Maraxus}.

entries.name: 4 Fragments — Sharpened Fate
entries: Your attack bonus increases to +2.

entries.name: 5 Fragments — Seal of Divination
entries: This seal now requires attunement.
The seal gains 3 charges. You may expend 1 charge to cast {@spell divination}.
The seal regains all expended charges at dawn.

entries.name: 6 Fragments — Oracle's Strike
entries: Your attack bonus increases to +3.

entries.name: 7 Fragments — Full Foresight
entries: You gain the Gift of Foresight:
• All attacks against you have disadvantage.
• You have advantage on all attack rolls.
• You have advantage on all saving throws.
These benefits do not apply against creatures who also possess Foresight.

entries.name: Fragments
entries: Fragments of the Oracle's Seal are found while searching for ways to release {@deity Maraxus}, the Oracle Demon of {@deity Cthulhu}.

item.name: Taxman's Blade
entries: This relic greatsword originates from another world.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.
This weapon deals 3d6 slashing damage instead of the normal {@damage 2d6}.
It deals an additional 2 force damage per level of the highest-level spell slot a creature has not yet used.

entries.name: Extended Reach
entries: As a bonus action, you may increase the size of the sword, giving it a reach of 15 feet.

entries.name: Bloodlust Curse
entries: If a non-Barbarian attempts to attune to this item, the attunement fails.
The creature must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or enter a bloodlust, becoming hostile to all creatures.
The creature may repeat the saving throw every minute.

item.name: Mjuen Axe
entries: +3 magic weapon.
On the first attack that hits on your turn, the attack deals an additional {@damage 4d6} damage of a type of your choice: cold, fire, poison, acid, lightning, or necrotic.
It takes a bonus action to change the damage type.
This weapon has the thrown property and teleports back to you after it hits.
As an action, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed for 1 minute. This can be used once per short or long rest.

item.name: X-7 Swiftstreak
entries: High-Speed Arcane Propulsion Bike (HSAPB).
AC: 16
Hit Points: 60
Speed: 120 ft per round
Maneuverability: +4 to Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks made to avoid obstacles or perform stunts.

entries.name: Arcane Propulsion System
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 4d6 force damage.

item.name: B-9 Battlebeast
entries: Heavy-Duty Arcane Combat Bike (HDACB).
AC: 18
Hit Points: 80
Speed: 90 ft per round
Maneuverability: +2 to Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks made to avoid obstacles or perform stunts.
Armor: +5 to AC

entries.name: Missile Launcher
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 300 ft., one target. Hit: 6d6 explosive damage.

entries.name: Flamethrower
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, 15-foot cone. Hit: 3d6 fire damage.

entries.name: Energy Blaster
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 4d8 radiant damage.

item.name: G-4 Touring Titan
entries: Multi-Purpose Arcane Touring Bike (MPATB).
AC: 15
Hit Points: 70
Speed: 100 ft per round
Maneuverability: +3 to Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks made to avoid obstacles or perform stunts.
Comfort: +5 to Constitution checks made to resist fatigue or exhaustion.

entries.name: Laser Rifle
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 300 ft., one target. Hit: 3d8 radiant damage.

item.name: R-2 Shadow Scout
entries: Arcane Stealth Reconnaissance Bike (ASRB).
AC: 15
Hit Points: 70
Speed: 80 ft per round
Maneuverability: +6 to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to avoid detection.
Stealth Systems: +5 to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to hide or move silently.

entries.name: Silent Blades
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2d6 piercing damage (magical).

item.name: C-5 Hauling Hound
entries: Arcane Cargo Transport Bike (ACTB).
AC: 12
Hit Points: 100
Speed: 60 ft per round
Maneuverability: +1 to Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks made to avoid obstacles or perform stunts.
Cargo Capacity: Can carry up to 2,000 pounds of cargo or equipment.
This vehicle has no built-in weapons.

item.name: Moonsilver
entries: Moonsilver is a celestial alloy originating from Zirael, a shattered lunar body blessed by {@deity Selûne}. It glows with a soft silver-blue radiance and responds to magical energy like a living conduit.

items: Mithril-Like Enchantability: Moonsilver accepts enchantments with exceptional ease. Items forged from it require half the usual time and reduced material cost to enchant.
{@item Residuum}-Like Arcane Conductivity: Moonsilver can store magical energy, substitute for spell slots, and power arcane engines.
Brumestone-Like Levitation: Moonsilver naturally interacts with gravity and arcane fields, enabling stable levitation and flight-based machinery.

entries.name: Origin
entries: Fragments of Zirael fell upon Arvanaith as a divine gift from {@deity Selûne}. Moonsilver is believed to resonate with lunar phases and celestial tides.

items: Arcane vehicles and skycraft
Legendary weapons and armor
Spell engines and reactors
Teleportation anchors
Celestial rituals and constructs

item.name: Synthetic Moonsilver (Cthularis)
entries: Cthularis is an artificial imitation of true {@item Moonsilver}, created through dangerous rituals or temporary arcane infusion. Though powerful, it lacks the purity and stability of genuine {@item Moonsilver}.

entries.name: Permanent Cthularis (Shadow Hand Ritual)
entries: The Shadow Hands developed a ritual to forge permanent Cthularis when cut off from A'vealyn.

items: Infused Adamantine: Created by melting adamantine with a rare or greater magic item at 3,500°C.
Ritual Requirements: A blood sacrifice equal in weight to the infused adamantine and three castings of {@spell Dark Star} (8th level), all concentrated for 1 minute.
Ritual Danger: Anything in the area takes {@damage 16d8} force damage or is disintegrated. If interrupted, the {@spell Dark Star} implodes, dealing {@damage 40d8} force damage within 200 feet.
Result: A permanent synthetic {@item Moonsilver alloy} with strong enchantability and levitation properties.

entries.name: Temporary Cthularis (Infusion Method)
entries: A safer but unstable method using a small sample of true {@item Moonsilver}.

items: {@item Moonsilver} essence is infused into mithril in a dwarven forge reaching 2,200°C.
Three {@skill Arcana} checks determine lifespan:
1–14: Lasts 1 month
15–21: Lasts 2 months
22+: Lasts 3 months
22+ with a natural 20: Lasts 4+ months
After expiration, the material reverts to normal mithril.

condition.name: Tormented
entries: A creature afflicted with the Tormented condition is wracked by invasive psychic agony and tethered to another creature through a shared rift of shadow. The condition has the following effects:

items: Disrupted Focus. The creature has disadvantage on all attack rolls. Some effects may replace this with a flat penalty instead.

Agony Link. If the creature is linked to another Tormented creature, it takes the psychic damage specified by the effect whenever the linked creature takes damage from that same effect. This psychic damage cannot trigger additional psychic damage.

No Interruption. The Tormented condition cannot be ended early by removing a condition, reducing exhaustion, or restoring hit points. Only the effect that inflicted Tormented can end it, unless the DM rules otherwise.
Saving Throws. A Tormented creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns if the effect that caused the condition allows it.

Break in the Link. If a Tormented creature succeeds on its saving throw while its linked partner fails, the successful creature may lose the Tormented condition or suffer a reduced version of it, depending on the effect that created the link.
